title: Drawing, "Fantasy of an Architectural Ruin", ca. 1770
medium: Pen and  black ink, black and brown wash, watercolor, white gouache graphite on off-white laid paper
provenance: from the collection of Leon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Antique sepulchers and ruins with figures in the foreground are presented in an oval format. A stairway leads to a triumphal arch at right, adjacent to a column.  In the distance at left, architectural forms incorporating arches balance the composition. Ruled lines in pen and ink.

exhibitions.title: Excavating Design: 18th-century Drawings and Prints from the Permanent Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Fantasy of an Architectural Ruin", ca. 1770.
ca. 1770. Pen and  black ink, black and brown wash, watercolor, white gouache graphite on off-white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-243.
